intro: Manettia smithii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves. Manettia smithii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
